title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.38 | 07-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: In this session we will be discussing from the 38th verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and an introduction to the verse that will be discussed.

segments.key_quote: As the name and fame of a particular body is finished with the disappearance of the living spirit, similarly, if you do not look upon us, all our fame and activities, along with the Pandavas and Yadus, will end at once.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and explains the meaning of Queen Kunti's prayer, emphasizing the devotee's dependence on Krishna.

segments.key_quote: We should know that every moment I should be dependent on Krishna's mercy only.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the concept of dependence on Krishna, urging listeners to be constantly Krishna conscious and avoid complacency.

segments.key_quote: But without the guidance of Lord Krishna, all of them are non-entities.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that even great figures like Yudhishthira and the Yadus are insignificant without Krishna's guidance.

segments.key_quote: No one should be proud of his prestige, power and fame, without being guided by the favor of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the importance of background consciousness and the need to be aware of the Supreme Lord's favor in all circumstances.

segments.key_quote: We should never wrongly think that I am dependent on something other than Krishna, someone other than Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker warns against relying on material solutions and emphasizes that Krishna is the ultimate source of protection, using the example of earthquake-proof buildings.

segments.key_quote: Our material arrangements ultimately will fail.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates the importance of Krishna's protection and the ultimate failure of material arrangements, even for important figures after death.

segments.key_quote: As soon as the life is gone the body is but a lump of matter.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the body is just a lump of matter once the soul departs, and the respect one receives in life vanishes after death.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is the real person personality in my life.
segments.summary: The speaker urges listeners to consciously depend on Krishna, emphasizing that Krishna is not an abstract concept but is present in everyone's heart.

segments.key_quote: The soul is also energy of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the soul is Krishna's energy and part and parcel of Him, differentiating between superior (soul) and inferior (material elements) nature.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is the energetic source of all energies and all energies belong to Krishna and Krishna can never be without his energy and energy cannot exist independently without Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by explaining the relationship between Krishna and His energies, emphasizing that Krishna and His energies are inseparable, and this understanding helps in becoming Krishna conscious.
